summary: The Child Care for Every Community Act aims to establish universal child care and early learning programs across the United States. It authorizes significant appropriations to provide financial assistance to prime sponsors for comprehensive child care services, including health, educational, and social support. Key provisions include defining eligibility, setting national program standards, establishing a sliding fee scale, and emphasizing community involvement. The bill also addresses staff qualifications, pay, and professional development, alongside requirements for program governance, coordination with K-12 education, and research on child development outcomes.
